decks.notes: The key strategy of this deck is to use cards like Ancestral Vision and As Foretold to build up resources and control the board until it can cast Restore Balance, wiping the board of both players while leaving the player with the advantage. The deck also utilizes Cascade effects with cards like Electrodominance and Greater Gargadon to cheat out spells for free. The goal is to disrupt the opponent's strategy while setting up a board state that allows for a quick victory.

This deck focuses on using +1/+1 counters to quickly build up powerful creatures and overwhelm the opponent with a swarm of threats. By utilizing cards like Hardened Scales, Arcbound Ravager, and Metallic Mimic, the deck aims to quickly buff up creatures and create an aggressive board presence. Cards like Walking Ballista and Hangarback Walker provide additional threats and ways to distribute counters. The deck also includes various ways to generate value with cards like Animation Module and Rishkar, Peema Renegade. Ultimately, the goal is to build up a board state that is difficult for the opponent to deal with efficiently.

This deck focuses on controlling the game through counterspells, removal, and card advantage. It aims to disrupt the opponent's game plan while slowly building up resources and eventually winning with powerful planeswalkers like Jace, the Mind Sculptor and Teferi, Hero of Dominaria. The deck also utilizes efficient removal spells like Path to Exile and Fatal Push, along with card draw spells like Hieroglyphic Illumination and Cryptic Command to outvalue the opponent. The mana base is built to support the control elements of the deck while being able to consistently cast spells of different colors.

The main focus of this deck is to quickly build a board of powerful Merfolk creatures and overwhelm the opponent with aggressive tactics. By utilizing cards like Benthic Biomancer, Lord of Atlantis, and Master of Waves, the deck aims to establish dominance on the battlefield and maintain control through counterspells like Deprive and Spell Pierce. Aether Vial helps in efficiently deploying creatures, while Spreading Seas disrupts the opponent's mana base. With a solid mana base of Islands, Mutavault, and Oboro, Palace in the Clouds, this deck aims to outpace and outmaneuver the opponent to secure a quick victory.

The deck focuses on a fast-paced, aggressive strategy using Merfolk creatures to quickly overwhelm the opponent. By utilizing powerful Lord creatures like Lord of Atlantis and Master of the Pearl Trident, the deck aims to boost the power of all Merfolk on the battlefield. The inclusion of disruptive spells like Merfolk Trickster and Spreading Seas allows for control over the opponent's board while maintaining pressure. Aether Vial helps to accelerate the deployment of creatures, while cards like Lightning Bolt provide additional reach and removal options.

This deck focuses on quickly casting cheap spells to trigger the Arclight Phoenix's ability and bring it back from the graveyard. By utilizing cards like Gut Shot, Lightning Bolt, Lava Spike, and Forked Bolt to deal damage and Faithless Looting and Light Up the Stage to draw cards, the deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with a flurry of fast-paced aggression. Soul-Scar Mage and Monastery Swiftspear provide additional prowess and Bedlam Reveler offers late-game card advantage.

The main concept of this Aggro - Hollow One deck is to utilize cards like Goblin Lore, Burning Inquiry, and Faithless Looting to quickly fill up the graveyard with creatures such as Hollow One, Bloodghast and Flamewake Phoenix. By discarding multiple cards from hand, players can power out big threats early in the game and overwhelm the opponent with a fast and aggressive strategy. The inclusion of cards like Bloodstained Mire and Blackcleave Cliffs help to ensure consistency and stability in mana base for a relentless assault on the opponent's life total.

This Modern Aggro - Affinity deck primarily focuses on quickly deploying artifact creatures and using them in conjunction with equipment and burn spells to deal massive damage to the opponent. The deck utilizes cards like Cranial Plating, Steel Overseer, and Signal Pest to pump up its creatures and create lethal threats. With key cards like Arcbound Ravager and Inkmoth Nexus, the deck can also present a surprise win condition by either sacrificing artifacts for a lethal attack or turning into an infect deck for a quick victory.

This deck focuses on disrupting opponents' mana base while deploying aggressive creatures to pressure them. By utilizing Thalia, Guardian of Thraben and Leonin Arbiter to tax their spells and search effects, it slows down their game plan. Aether Vial allows for creatures to be put into play at instant speed, providing unexpected interactions. Thought-Knot Seer and Eldrazi Displacer offer disruption and card advantage, while Restoration Angel can provide value by flickering key creatures like Blade Splicer. Overall, the deck aims to control the board while applying pressure to close out the game quickly.

The primary aim of this deck is to quickly gain life through playing cards like Martyr of Sands and Serra Ascendant, while also utilizing cards like Ranger of Eos to search for key creatures. The deck focuses on a strong aggro strategy using efficient creatures and removal spells like Path to Exile and Wrath of God to control the board. The inclusion of cards like Ghostly Prison and Emeria, the Sky Ruin provide additional defense and late-game value. The deck aims to overwhelm opponents with a mix of aggression and resilience.

The deck aims to cheat out big threats like Primeval Titan early in the game by using cards like Azusa, Lost but Seeking and Amulet of Vigor to ramp up quickly. It also utilizes cards like Hive Mind and Pact of Negation for protection while setting up a powerful combo finish. The key strategy is to effectively manage resources and utilize the unique abilities of the Amulet Titan archetype to overwhelm the opponent with powerful creatures and win conditions.

The deck revolves around assembling a toolbox of creatures with various abilities, utilizing the combo between Devoted Druid and Vizier of Remedies to generate infinite mana. The deck can then use Chord of Calling and Collected Company to tutor for key creatures and combo pieces, creating explosive turns and overwhelming board presence. The Creatures Toolbox archetype allows for flexibility and adaptability in responding to different matchups and situations, making it a versatile and powerful deck in Modern 1 vs 1 format.

This deck focuses on utilizing powerful red planeswalkers and fast, aggressive creatures to overwhelm opponents. The goal is to control the board with enchantments like Chalice of the Void and Ensnaring Bridge, while using disruptive cards like Eidolon of the Great Revel to punish opponents for casting spells. The deck also aims to disrupt opponent's mana base with cards like Blood Moon and Gemstone Caverns. With a mix of burn spells, fast mana, and disruption, this deck aims to outpace and outlast opponents in a fast-paced Modern format.

The main concept of this deck is to ramp quickly with Sakura-Tribe Elder, Farseek, and Search for Tomorrow to get Valakut, the Molten Pinnacle on the battlefield. By using Primeval Titan and Through the Breach, you can quickly bring out multiple Mountains to trigger Valakut's ability and deal massive damage to your opponent. Chalice of the Void helps to control the opponent's spells while Simian Spirit Guide provides additional mana acceleration. The deck's goal is to overwhelm the opponent with sudden bursts of damage from Valakut triggers.

This Golgari Aggro deck focuses on disrupting the opponent's game plan with hand disruption spells like Inquisition of Kozilek and Thoughtseize, while also dealing with threats on the board using removal spells like Fatal Push and Assassin's Trophy. The deck aims to apply pressure early with efficient creatures like Tarmogoyf and Dark Confidant, and generate card advantage with cards like Tireless Tracker and Liliana of the Veil. The deck utilizes a mix of aggressive creatures, removal, and disruption to control the game and outvalue the opponent.

The main concept of this deck is to disrupt your opponent's game plan by taxing their resources with cards like Thalia, Guardian of Thraben and Leonin Arbiter, while also applying pressure with creatures like Scavenging Ooze and Restoration Angel. Aether Vial allows for quick creature deployment, while Path to Exile provides removal for problematic threats. The deck also uses flicker effects like Flickerwisp and Eternal Witness to gain additional value from enters-the-battlefield triggers. Additionally, the deck has land disruption with Ghost Quarter and Field of Ruin to further disrupt the opponent's mana base.

The main idea of this deck is to generate mana quickly and efficiently through spells like Pyretic Ritual and Manamorphose to cast a large number of spells in a single turn. This deck also focuses on card selection and drawing, utilizing cards like Serum Visions and Sleight of Hand to find combo pieces. The end goal is to use the Storm mechanic to chain together a large number of spells and finish the game with Grapeshot or Empty the Warrens for a massive amount of damage.

The main concept of this deck is to use aggressive creatures like Wild Nacatl, Tarmogoyf, Monastery Swiftspear, and Death's Shadow to deal a large amount of damage quickly to the opponent. Supporting cards like Mishra's Bauble, Thoughtseize, and Dismember help control the opponent's resources and disrupt their game plan. Temur Battle Rage and Become Immense provide ways to pump up the creatures for explosive turns. The deck aims to apply constant pressure and close out the game before the opponent can stabilize.

The deck focuses on assembling the Jeskai Ascendancy combo by using cards like Manamorphose, Cerulean Wisps, and Fatestitcher to generate mana and untap creatures. Glittering Wish allows the player to search for key pieces of the combo, while cards like Serum Visions and Sleight of Hand help dig for necessary cards. The deck aims to go off quickly and overwhelm the opponent with a large combo turn, utilizing the powerful Jeskai Ascendancy to pump up creatures and draw cards to maintain momentum.

The deck focuses on a fast-paced aggressive playstyle using efficient removal spells and disruptive hand disruption to control the game early on. It utilizes powerful creatures like Tarmogoyf, Dark Confidant, and Bloodbraid Elf to apply pressure on the opponent and close out the game quickly. The deck also contains versatile planeswalkers like Liliana of the Veil and sideboard options like Assassin's Trophy to handle a variety of threats. The mana base is optimized for consistency and speed, allowing the deck to deploy threats and disrupt the opponent's game plan efficiently.
